channel.title: Player greyed out during the day
channel.description:
#### What happened? D1: Put a scout on 9, N1: Investigate 6 N1: Scout got tripped, 9 was converted. Also, 6 (original assassin) came up unseen 16, the possessor died that night, reasons unknown as the player left the game
D2: 6 was no longer selectable from the right side player list, could not put him up. His bar was a light grey shade, no red number. No system message stating his death. Nobody knew if he if he was dead or alive (MM might) N2: 6 was no longer targetable from the number selector box. D3: 6 showed up as alive in court for the rest of the game, but still not clickable. We put up and executed 9 who at that point was an assassin, implying that 6 had died N1 or N2.
#### What was SUPPOSED to happen? Player 6 should have been targetable if alive or show up as dead.
#### Steps to reproduce: This is just speculation but some combination of actions could have resulted in this: 1. Have an assassin attack a hunter that has a bear, or a target with a knight guarding 2. Have a possessor jump into that assassin 3. Have an investigative class check the assassin 4. Watch the system go nuts trying to resolve all statuses
It could also just have been a more general error as more things went wrong that game.
#### Comments: Note: Result messages popped up 3 times for a lot of players, including me (inv only, scout showed once) More things went wrong that game: People seemed to be massively abstaining at faster than expected speed
Did not make a screenshot, unfortunately. Did upload my log. Here is an excerpt:
https://drive.google.com/open?id=1kQtyuv7FHdugtl_3KhgLDA8YMl-nAM8GnYU2dAxwbdA
Full log is here: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1VrvKpfmpAxMv_CvaEjMt3pNUTgMNGKyE
